intro: Scolopia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar scolopia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds. Scolopia madagascariensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
